title: District volleyball races heat up
text:
District volleyball races heat up Bobby Ardoin 4:47 p.m. CDT October 19, 2015 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
District volleyball races involving area teams are racing to a conclusion, with several key matchups scheduled this week. 
The race in Division V District 1 involves four teams, with the Academy of the Sacred Heart undefeated after two games. 
ASH and Westminster Christian are involved in a close race for first place, a matter that could be decided Thursday when Sacred Heart visits the Crusaders. 
Before that game however, the two schools will be involved in other league matches Tuesday night. 
Northside Christian visits ASH on Tuesday, while Westminster travels to Lake Charles to meet Hamilton Christian. 
Overall ASH is 12-12, while Westminster is 18-12. The Crusaders are 2-1 in district after defeating Hamilton last week on their home court 3-0. 
ASH has been guided in recent matches by the attacking of outside hitter Erin Mockler and team assist leader Maci Quebeeaux. 
Westminster, under first-year head coach Kim Barber has senior Blythe Thompson as its leader with assists. 
The Crusaders’ power game is highlighted by Moriah Brooks, Neilee Newton and Ivy Cains. Stacia Newton recorded six kills in last Tuesday’s 3-0 loss at ASH. 
Beau Chene 
The Gators were scheduled to play at Highland Baptist in a non-district game Monday. 
On Tuesday Beau Chene is set to play at Breaux Bridge followed by another away match at Opelousas High on Thursday. Both matches are Division II District 2 matchups. 
Overall Beau Chene is 5-14 and 0-2 in district. 
The Gators extended a three-game losing streak last Tuesday with a 3-1 defeat by Opelousas. In that match, Beau Chene won the first game (28-24) before dropping the last three sets. 
Church Point 
The Bears begin the week 9-14 and 4-4 in Division III District 3. 
Church Point was busy in tournament action this past weekend finishing 2-2. 
The Bears defeated C.E. Byrd (2-0) lost to New Iberia (2-0) and then defeated Airline (2-1). In the final tourney match, Church Point was defeated by Ellender 2-1 after winning the first set. 
Church Point climbs back into the district race Tuesday when the Bears travel to Iota. 
Eunice 
The Bobcats, also in Division III District 3, began their first season of volleyball 0-9 before defeating district and parish rival Northwest High last week 3-2. 
Eunice is 1-6 in district and has matches scheduled at Crowley on Tuesday followed by a home match with Rayne on Wednesday. 
In the Northwest match, Eunice fell behind 1-0 after losing the first game (25-16). Then the Bobcats rolled up two straight victories (25-23 and 25-21). The Raiders claimed the third set (25-19) before Eunice clinched the match with a 15-7 win. 
Northwest 
NWHS is 3-9 overall and 1-5 in District 3. 
The Raiders play at Rayne on Tuesday and Church Point on Thursday in key league matches. 
Opelousas 
The Tigers are 5-13 under first-year head coach Theresa Adams. 
Opelousas is 1-1 in district games with a loss to Carencro and a victory over Beau Chene. 
OHS has won three of the last seven games and the Tigers play at Carencro on Thursday in a league contest. The Tigers opened Division II District 2 with a loss to Carencro.
